resources.string: " This is the DailyBudget home screen.\\nHere you can quickly see this month's expenses as well as their total. "
At the bottom of the screen, you\'ll find a navigation menu that lets you navigate to your spending history and app settings.
Here\'s the budget you can still spend this month. You can change it in the settings window.
In the bottom corner you will find the button to add new expenses.\\nRemember to do this every time you pay for something.
This month\'s spending is grouped by type.\\nYou can manage these types in the settings window.
These are your expense entries. They reflect every transaction you\'ve made. You can click on an expense entry to delete or edit it.

Here you can see your expenses grouped by day, month, or year, and if you go into a day, you\'ll be able to see all the transactions you made that day.\\nThe graph shows your budget limit for each period in green.
The top bar shows the period you are looking at and the total amount spent during that period.
With the highlighted button in the upper right corner of the screen you can show or hide the expense graph.
With the highlighted button in the upper right corner of the screen, you can export the data you are querying to CSV format.
Here you can establish your monthly budget.\\nThis is the budget on which expenses and savings will be calculated.
In the middle of the screen are the expense types. There are some established suggestions, but feel free to change them or add new ones if you need to make it fit you perfectly.
If you long-press the expense circle, you\'ll see a summary of your expenses for that period by item.\\nThis also works if you tap on any of the bars in the chart above.
